intro: Microberlinia, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to various regions of Africa, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its large, deciduous leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits containing seeds. Microberlinia species are often found in woodland and savanna habitats, contributing to local biodiversity. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
